awd_titl_txt: SBIR Phase II:  Advanced in-home technologies for infant thermoneutrality
awd_abstract_narration:
The broader impact/commercial potential of this Phase II project will be to empower and educate caregivers to make scientifically guided decisions that enable safer and optimally nurturing sleep environments for infants.  Every year more than 130 million babies are born and over 4 million of those are born in the U.S.  Due to Sudden Infant Death Syndrome (SIDS), 300 babies every month may not live to see their first birthday.  SIDS remains the leading cause of death for babies aged one month to one year.  Infant mortality rates in the U.S. are higher than in the 20 wealthiest nations.  Innogized Technologies has developed a transformative Internet of Things technology (IoT) that combines hardware and analytics to enable caregivers to make better sleep-time decisions, avoiding overheating, a known stressor for SIDS.  The technology guides caregivers to deliver optimal conditions for safe, regenerative and developmental growth for their infants anywhere and anytime, while at the same time relieving anxiety.  This technology is poised to immediately capture a sizable portion of the rapidly growing $1 billion US baby monitoring solutions market.

This Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase II project will support the development of a novel consumer product that works  with caregivers to proactively mitigate the risk of under/overheating events in newborns. Sleep-time clothing choices are thermodynamically matched with environmental conditions to create baby-specific safe sleep environments.  The temperatures are  maintained by leveraging the inherent connectivity of the IoT platform. The technology integrates thermal resistance measurements, thermal models and maps, advanced algorithms, and predictive monitoring.  The research objectives of the project tackle the most important remaining technical challenges driving towards successful commercialization and adoption of a product that is essentially an intelligent system, capable of understanding context and tracking and managing complex interactions while anticipating requirements.  The technical product of this research will advance caregiver knowledge and increase understanding of the applied thermodynamics leading to the advantageous state of thermoneutrality as well as increase infant wellbeing.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
This Small Business Innovation Research Phase II project supported the development of novel consumer products that work with caregivers to proactively mitigate the risk of under/overheating events in infants. Sudden unexpected infant death (SUID), which includes Sudden Infant Death Syndrome (SIDS) and strangulation in bed (ASSB), remains the leading cause of death for babies aged one month to one year of age.  Due to SUID more than 300 babies every month may not live to see their first birthday.  Infant mortality rates in the U.S. remain higher than in the 20 wealthiest nations.  This project addressed these facts and provides a meaningful contribution to mitigating risk and reducing these alarming numbers using new technology.

This project provided caregivers with technology that empowers and educates them to make scientifically guided decisions that enable safer and optimally nurturing sleep environments for infants.

This successful project found a variety of ways to ensure the technology products developed were broad reaching throughout society.  A software-only product was developed to ensure extremely broad access to the technological and scientific outcomes of this project. A patented hardware and software product was also developed to provide a deeper level of support and well-being.

Advanced technologies were developed to match environmental conditions with sleep-time clothing choices to create baby-specific safe sleep environments. The hardware technology product developed uses a unique approach to maintaining the thermal match between sleep-time outfits and room temperature, leveraging the inherent connectivity of the IoT platform. The hardware developed integrates thermal resistance predictions, thermal models and maps, and advanced algorithms to reduce the risk of life-threatening infant overheating at sleep time, provide specific safe-sleep education, reduce caregiver anxiety, and improve family well-being.

The technical product of this research advances caregiver knowledge and increases understanding of the applied thermodynamics leading to the advantageous state of thermoneutrality which increases infant wellbeing, in an easy to understand and novel way never seen before.  The developed Deep Technology functions under the surface while the user is easily guided through the process of mitigating risks and creating better nurturing sleep environments for babies, every time and anywhere.

The developed technological product was branded Neut.  Neuts new thermal technologies generate a virtually instant and reliable approximation of thermal resistance in uncontrolled environments with just a hand-held device and/or software operable by the layman. It is all made possible by pseudo-intelligent algorithms and an innovative interface that was continually developed to elegantly convey the results of complex thermodynamics such that any user can easily understand. Additionally, the software delivers targeted specific safe-sleep education to help parents gain more confidence with every use.

As promised, Neuts unique technological approach has been shown to empower caregivers to personally mitigate risk upstream. As opposed to common reactive technologies in the baby-tech market that simply monitor and alarm when something's amiss, Neut proactively educates the caregiver and arms them with the tools they need to make safe sleep-time decisions.  This new technology provides specific recommendations, guidance and reassures caregivers.

This project delivered a revolutionary and empowering approach that is exactly what research showed caregivers needed. The users of the technology describe it as truly novel, enabling caregivers to create safe sleep environments in ways that were not possible before this project. It provides safety and assurance through application of cutting-edge science. 

This project catalyzed the development of the deep technologies that empower Neut, and Neut enables infant safe-sleep and improves family well-being for everyone, everywhere and every time.

Modified by: Oliver M Smith
